STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 29, 2025
Tishara Price
MACOMB COUNTY DHHS
44777 N Gratiot Ave,
Clinton Township, MI, 48036-1362
Re: License #: CP500201269
SI #: 2025SIC0000601
Dear Tishara Price:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above reference facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any report violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000601
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 24, 2025
License #: CP500201269
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: Tishara Price
Agency Name: MACOMB COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 44777 N Gratiot Ave
Clinton Township, MI 48036-1362
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/20/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
5/21/2025 9:00 AM Documentation Other
5/20/2025 10:20 AM Phone Interview
5/1/2025 1:30 PM Phone Interview
5/1/2025 12:00 PM Video Conference Interview
4/25/2025 11:00 AM Phone Interview
4/24/2025 4:30 PM Email Special Investigation Initiation
4/24/2025 2:00 PM Documentation Other
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on
Section central registry.
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Care worker disclosed Biological Mother's confidential
medical information to Relative Caregiver without her consent.
Investigation Biological Mother was interviewed via telephone on April 25,
2025. She stated her children were removed from her care in July
2022 and placed with Relative Caregiver 1 & Relative Caregiver 2.
She stated in August/September 2022 she was pregnant and
hospitalized. One week into the hospital stay she delivered a
stillborn baby. She had planned on letting Youth A know about the
baby during her next parenting time. She stated Youth A had been
very excited about the new baby and talked about another sibling
all the time.
Biological Mother stated within one week of her baby being
stillborn Relative Caregiver 1 & Relative Caregiver 2 were
messaging her and referenced the stillbirth. She wondered how
they knew and reached out to Foster Care worker (FCW) and
asked how they knew since that was not something she had
informed them of. She stated FCW reported she was under the
impression they already knew and told them herself. She stated
she bought a new phone since that time and does not believe she
still has the messages but will look.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via video
conference on May 1, 2025. She stated she has been the
assigned FCW since the foster care case opened in July 2022.
She stated Biological Mother had been in the hospital for an
unknown reason in August/September 2022 and there was a
period of time FCW wasn’t able to locate her. She was eventually
notified by Biological Mother’s mother who reported she needed to
be petitioned into the hospital for mental health treatment. While in
the hospital, Biological Mother lost her unborn baby.
FCW stated Biological Mother ended up contacting FCW after
about 3 weeks of not being able to locate her. Biological Mother
called FCW while still hospitalized and told her what had
happened, and she lost her baby. There was discussion regarding
Youth A being upset about the baby and a plan was discussed
regarding the best way to tell her. The decision was made to tell
her about the loss of the baby during a session with Youth A’s
therapist with Biological Mother present. FCW reported Biological
Mother had informed her it was ok to discuss with Relative
Caregiver 1 & Relative Caregiver 2, who had placement of Youth
A during this timeframe, for the purpose of scheduling the therapy
session and informing the therapist.
2

FCW stated she had a conversation with Relative Caregiver 1 &
Relative Caregiver 2, as discussed with Biological Mother, and
asked them to schedule a therapy appointment for Youth A and
Biological Mother so Biological Mother could inform her of the loss
of the baby.
Foster Care supervisor (FC supervisor) was interviewed via
telephone on May 1, 2025. She stated Biological Mother lost her
unborn baby in late summer 2022. Biological Mother had given
consent for FCW to disclose the information to Youth A’s therapist
at New Oakland as well as Relative Caregiver 1 & Relative
Caregiver 2 in order to coordinate services and set up an
appointment so Youth A could be notified in a therapeutic setting.
FC supervisor stated Youth A is young and has been participating
in counseling services since she was removed from Biological
Mother in 2022. At the time this occurred the therapist required a
caregiver to be in the room during sessions due to her age. She
clarified the caregivers did not participate in sessions but were
required to be present. FC supervisor stated Biological Mother
was aware of that requirement and had given consent so FCW
could coordinate the counseling appointment for Biological Mother
and Youth A once Biological Mother was released from the
hospital.
Relative Caregiver 1 & Relative Caregiver 2 were interviewed
via telephone on May 20, 2025. Relative Caregiver 1 had the call
on speaker phone and Relative Caregiver 2 also participated in
the interview. She stated she recalled learning Biological Mother
had lost her baby, but she was adamant it was not FCW who
reported the information to them. She stated this took place a few
years ago and could not recall who had disclosed the information
to them but was sure it was not FCW. Relative Caregiver 1 stated
they were already aware that Biological Mother had lost her baby
by the time FCW mentioned it to them. Relative Caregiver 1
clarified they were working with FCW to schedule a counseling
session for Youth A so Biological Mother could be present and
inform Youth A of the news herself in a therapeutic setting.
Relative Caregiver 1 stated at the time Biological Mother lost the
baby in late summer 2022, Biological Mother was allowed to call
their home to speak with her children who had been placed in their
care. Biological Mother called their home and asked to speak with
Youth A. During the phone call Youth A walked into her bedroom
and they were not able to hear the discussion. During the phone
call Biological Mother informed Youth A that she had lost the baby
3

and Youth A was very distraught. Relative Caregiver 1 stated she
was so upset with how she handled the situation after everyone,
including Biological Mother, was in agreement to notify Youth A in
a therapeutic setting.
Documents reviewed:
• Youth A’s MISACWIS case.
September 6, 2022, social work contact: FCW asks legal
dad what is going on with Biological Mother. Legal dad
disclosed Biological Mother had a miscarriage and lost her
baby.
September 8, 2022, social work contact: “Phone call to
Relative Caregiver 1; Informed her about the situation
regarding Biological Mother and the loss of the baby.
Relative Caregiver 1 stated Youth A has her first
appointment with her psychiatrist on September 14, 2022.
Discussed the best way to inform Youth A of the loss of the
baby; Agreed that Youth A's psychiatrist should be involved
with deciding the appropriate delivery method.
September 14, 2022, social work contact: Phone call with
Nurse Practitioner from New Oakland. Relative Caregiver 2
informed her Biological Mother lost her baby and discussed
how to appropriately deliver the news to Youth A.
Discussed the plan to schedule a therapeutic meeting with
Biological Mother, Youth A and therapist.
October 26, 2022, social work contact: Phone call with
Relative Caregiver 2. He stated Youth A was on the phone
with Biological Mother last night and snuck away into her
bedroom with the phone. Relative Caregiver 2 reported he
went in Youth A's room to find her lying in bed and crying.
He reported Youth A eventually came up to him and told
him she knows her mom lost the baby. Relative Caregiver 2
stated he is very frustrated that Biological Mother knowingly
told Youth A while FCW was working on setting up a
therapeutic visit between Biological Mother and Youth A to
deliver the information.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance. Both Biological Mother
and FCW confirmed there was a telephone call between the two
of them. Biological Mother reported she did not provide consent
during the call for FCW to provide her medical information to
Relative Caregiver 1 and Relative Caregiver 2. FCW says
Biological Mother did provided consent during the call. In review
of the detailed social worker contacts and case file, there is no
documentation that the telephone call occurred, nor consent was
provided.
4

Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the current license status be continued.
___________5/28/2025________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 29, 2025
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
